New Records: Virat Kohli became the highest run-scorer in the T20 World Cup with 220 runs, KL Rahul scored 50 off 32 balls, and Litton Das hit 60 off 27 balls
Key Match Events: Litton Das was run out by KL Rahul's direct hit, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul scored heavily, Bangladesh lost key players including Shakib Al Hasan and Litton Das late in the innings
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan chose to bowl first due to uncertainty about the pitch conditions, India opted to bat first as they believed the pitch was good for batting
Post-Match Reflections: India secured a hard-fought five-run victory, moving to the top of Group 2, Bangladesh's loss was a heartbreak for their fans
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain but resumed after a delay, the ground was greasy but play continued, the match was a high-stakes encounter with significant implications for both teams
